reviewText:
Product received for free

PROS :
Good graphics.
Cool soundtracks.
Nice hawaiian theme.
Easy to 100% the achievements.
Controller support.

CONS :
Unoptimised, many lags.
Low FPS.
No options menu.
No option to rebind the controls.
The gameplay is terrible (walking, combat...etc)
Mouse sensitivity problems.

I hope the developper will fix the issues in this game, but you can still try it since it's free.

▂▃▅▇█ Final judgement : 55/100 █▇▅▃▂

reviewText:
Today's ancient Hawaiian saying:  Never drink milk from a coconut you found in the dark!"


Wow...this game is almost like a lawsuit from Nintendo waiting to happen.

You play as Maui trying to save your sister on your island by appealing to the Gods of Hawaii...that's....really the whole plot.

So
date: what makes this game so...."Lawsuit worthy"?  Well...I'd like to say that it comes to "coincidence" in this 30-90 minute game...depending on your framerate and untrustworthy
recommended:
oversensitive camera...

Exhibit 1: The island.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=691252625

Two halves of an island separated by a river and a "halo cloud" reminiscent of Death Mountain or Dragon Roost Island?  Nope....definitely never seen that in The Legend of Zelda before....

Exhibit 2:  The big pig carrying.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=691252389

Have I had to carry pigs before as a task?  Have I had to carry them over my head?  Mmmm....nope....doesn't sound like The Legend of Zelda: Windwaker to me...

Of course
hoursPlayed: let's not forget some pretty bad sword-combat....which you're better off doing a Hulk Smash to bypass.  (Missing screenshot due to awful frame rate (which only runs at 10 FPS or less as quite a few other reviews have complained about).  As if the awful frame rate was not enough
voteText: the camera is probably one of the most sensitive things I have seen since hearing from families who have suffered tragedies.  (Oh
helpfulPercent: and there is no OPTIONS menu where you can alter the settings to decrease settings to improve performance.  Have fun with that...)\n\nThough this game has a noble purpose in "educating" people about Hawaiian culture
votesHelpful: the "Learning" areas are completely optional.  Too many reasons for me to flunk this game.....is there something that takes the cake?   Yes
votesTotal: this is a STUDENT PROJECT!!!\n\n1/10  Free
commentsCount: but needs a LOT of work....and may get sued by Nintendo...\n\n(Also
column16: Windwaker is much better than this...even if it was kinda' boring most of the time.)"

reviewText:
Growing up and living on the Island of Kauai I instantly wanted to try this out. Within the first 3 seconds of the menu screen I fell in love with the music and the cute art design reminds me of the local made picture books for the keiki.

Mahalo Nui Loa for the awesome little game.

Yes the actual game was buggy and I did refer to a guide to help me along the way with what to do. But in all honesty it was a good free experience. Thank you again!

-Edit-

I forgot, the controls aren't the best and can take a minute getting used to. Sometimes it was hard getting the coconut and picking up the coconut. Also navigating the screen while trying to get the pig was hard.

But I did finish the game in half an hour.

reviewText: I went into Maui not really expecting much, but I have to say I liked it. For the free price, it was worth it, I defintely wouldn't spend any money on this game, but it worked rather well. Others were talking about slow framerate and I didn't have any one of their problems. It was a quick play, it took me about 45 minutes even when I was a bit confused.\n\nOverall, I'd reccomend it. I think it brings a different sort of idea to the community and it's obviously very accurate. Perhaps I'd pay money if there were more 'chapters' of this, like different stories to it. Also a pronounciation guide would be nice. It's quick and if you're looking for a good tale, it's here.

reviewText: One day this game might be worth playing, but as for now dont waste your time with it. Most importantly if you look at this game as something you will enjoy when it is finished do yourself the favor and DO NOT PLAY IT UNTIL ITS COMPLETELY FINISHED! The game itself looks like it will be a fun game to play one day when/if its completed. The graphics and setting are reminiscent of Zelda Wind Waker and if it plays like it, it will be a instant success. Looks like the game will have a decent story behind it with i hope good character development. All in all i have hopes for this game even though the less than 3 minutes i spent playing it made me want to throw myself down 36 flights of stairs. I mean there is no sound effects while in combat and you dont even swim you just walk under the water until you reach the other shore. It runs slow and the sound is choppy. earlyaccessiscancer

reviewText:
(TL;DR at bottom)
The game has alot of potential. After reading the reviews about the messed up tutorial, I have to say I was worried when the tutorial came up. The scene was very basic, almost ugly, but I was relieved when I actually got into the game. The character animation was basic, but that's to be expected on such a small game. But what really took the cake for me was the artistic style. It was actually quite enjoyable. The soundtrack is also killer, making this game a good casual game to play. I will definitely play more. I only stopped to write this review!

TL;DR
Pro: Attractive art
Pro: Great Soundtrack
Pro: Educational!

Con: Basic animation
Con: Some enemy balance issues.

reviewText:
The mechanics in the game are terrible.

Ground smash should atleast be able to stun the enemy, if not damage them, yet it's only useful for getting coconuts from trees which fails 99% of the time.

All actions are way too slow, including attacks.

There's no jumping option even though the game is designed in a manner that makes it entirely possible and sometimes necessary.

The concepts of Hawaiian myth the game uses are incredibly limited; the game misses almost every part of the mythology and only uses crumbs from it.

The game fails to acknowledge personal spiritual development, which one would think would be mentioned in a Hawaiian game about family honor.

The game's models are stereotypical and limited.

The controls are iffy; if anything, right-click should just cycle between the favors.

You grew up on a beach and you can't swim. Priceless.

The use of Hawaiian terms is less than subtle. Most games that introduce new terminology do so slowly over time, rather than in your face like this game does.

Despite being open world, the game is exceedingly linear due to enemy stats and character development.


All in all, huge disappointment.

I wish I was on Hawaii after playing this ... Growing up and living on the Island of Kauai I instantly wanted to try this out. Within the first 3 seconds of the menu screen I fell in love with the music and the cute art design reminds me of the local made picture books for the keiki.

Mahalo Nui Loa for the awesome little game.

Yes the actual game was buggy and I did refer to a guide to help me along the way with what to do. But in all honesty it was a good free experience. Thank you again!

reviewText:
Couldn't figure out how to kill the tutorial demon.
End up killing myself by attacking his fire shield.
Restart.
Follow instructions at light speed.
Fall through ground.
Broke the game before I could finish the tutorial.

Indie/10


Don't believe me? Check my screenshot m8

PART 2:
After restarting and smashing the ♥♥♥♥ out of his fire shield, I proceeded to attack and kill the snake demone.
Old guy tells me how to harvest mana etc, basic stuff (just skipped the actual task and talked to him again).
Venture to win favour of the other 3 base gods to go on a quest to reunite the storyline.
I've noticed that the physics aren't too good. Drop a coconut, it rolls up a mountain at light speed then comes to an abrupt stop, jump off a cliff: instantly on the ground below, no damage penalty.

Speed feature is really useful, considering without it you're slow as ♥♥♥♥, and being an rpg, there's a massive(?) map to explore.

5/10 (based on 20 minutes of gameplay), could be more polished and bug-free, but cool idea. This game has places to go, but it will rely on more work from the developers.

reviewText: I think this game has a lot of potential tbh. Unfortunatly, there are a lot of problems. My main two ones are no jump/climb cliff and poor optimisation. The game looked terrible, and lagged a ton. I do have ♥♥♥♥♥♥ PC, but it definatly runs games better than this. However, if you have a decent PC and just keep in mind this is a FREE indie game, you should definetly give it a try. I personnaly loved the switching abilities on the fly idea, and think it could and should be taken further.\n\nEDIT: Also love the island ;;;))))) Lots of memories from when I was too stupid to play the original and just goofed off on the main island in Windwaker.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Pros
Cute graphics - I've seen one comparison to Wind Waker, but to me it was a little of that and a little of Okami.
Story - Also reminded me strongly of Okami, which is never a bad thing. It had just the right balance of exposition and info to gameplay, also.
Music - Excellent. Fit the game, without being intrusive, which is what all video game music should strive for.

Cons
Combat - I came to this directly after fumbling around in Dark Souls, and I feel like the combat in this is just as harsh and unforgiving. I wasn't expecting to have to kite in this, and exploit the fact that enemy health doesn't regenerate while you run and eat healing items. Basically every enemy killed me in one or two hits, and in the case of some of the enemies, that would mean having to run across the entire island again to get back to them.
Quests and map - The quests were a little unclear, and the map was no help at all. Granted, the island is small, and there are only so many places to check for things, but with no indication of even a general area to look in, it had me running around aimlessly until I stumbled upon the thing I was looking for. Also, that the text doesn't change after you get the item is a bit confusing. I'm super ADD and fight with brain fog every day, and by the time I got my coconut I'd already forgotten what I was supposed to do with it. The shrines aren't even on the map, and there's nowhere to get more detailed quest info, like once you get the coconut
date: take it to the shrine to _____
recommended: which is on the western side of the island". Or something like that.\n\nOverall

reviewText:
Product received for free

It's free to play so it's hard to go wrong with something free, but the game is still very early in development.

There are times when I died, but it took ten seconds or so to realize I'd died. You can see weird textures, and everything is laggy. The game is still a mess.

So why is it recommended? Because I'm so psyched for a game about Hawaiian culture. I was expecting something like Never Alone and while it was far from being so polished and nice, there is a lot of potential here that I hope to see realized one day.
